result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth R Wierzba

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 1:29pm
INCLUDES 13CM1922, 13CM2122, 13TR7152 (tracking), and 15CM983
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher.  Deft appears in person with Atty Peter Rotter.
  
State filed criminal complaint from collateral attack to amend criminal complaint to 13CM192
Atty Rotter waives any further reading

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to:
13CM1922 
Amend Ct. 1 to OWI (3rd) 
Amend Ct. 2 to Operating w/ PAC (3rd) >> D&RI
13CM2122
Ct. 1 Operating Commercial Motor Vehicle w/o license - WI resident >> D&RI
13TR7152
Ct. 1 Operate CMV with PAC > 0.0% >> Dismissed outright
15CM983 
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
13CM1922
Ct. 1 OWI (3rd) >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: eligible for SSTOP program. w/hold sentencing. 18 months probation. Impose 160 MCJ, stay 30 days pursuant to SSTOP. 
CONDITIONS: Pay $2180.00 fine, inclusive. Eligible for huber release for work, school, or treatment if meets jail criteria, or ankle monitor if agents deems necessary. 28 months drivers license revocation, administrative credit given to time already served. 28 months IID installed immediately, time will not begin until obtain valid license. Complete AODA assessment, whic deft has already completed. Pay AODA fee. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, unless by perscription and only take medication as perscribed. No DNA sample or surcharge due to time period of charge. Zero days credit. 

Adj: 1:49pm

Pre-trial conference at 10-22-2015 10:00 am.
Plea hearing at 11-25-2015 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 
3:53pm
INCLUDES 15CM983, 13CM1922, 13CM2122, 13TR7152 (tracking)
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Deft appears in person with Atty Peter Rotter

State disagrees with collateral attack motion from 94CM377 OWI case where defendent did not understand the right to obtain counsel
COURT addresses affidavit signed by defendent 
COURT finds prima facie has been made
State references to case State of Wisconsin vs. Alan Ernst case in this matter 
Atty Rotter addresses affidavit 

Defendent is sworn in and testifies 
State makes argument 
Atty Rotter makes counter argument 
COURT is not convinced defendent was aware of penalties or right to counsel in 1994 case
COURT finds defendent was no advised to right to attorney or right to penalties
COURT grants motion in prior conviction on 08/10/1994 can not be used

CC with Br 1 JA

Adj: 4:42pm

Case Called: 2:23pm. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears by Atty Peter Rotter. Matter set for Motions - will now be an Initial Apperarnce. Atty Rotter makes statment re: transcripts to be requested re: collateral act. Special Apperance. W/R. PLEA: NOT GUILTY. Arguments to Bond. Signature Bond $250.00. No Special Conditions; Conditions in 13CM1922 remain in effect. DATES: Mtn for Collateral Attack - 9/8/15 @ 11:15am. Adjourned: 2:27pm.
